intro: Pourretia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic, which is a common trait among members of its family.
